faqs.question: How do I become a sponsor?
faqs.answer: Check out the sponsorship packet under 'Become a Sponsor' on the homepage and/or email us directly!

faqs.question: How do I register?
faqs.answer: There will be a link on this website once registration opens.

faqs.question: When does registration open?
faqs.answer: We will open registration for the Datathon in the fall.

faqs.question: How many people can be on a team?
faqs.answer: You are allowed a maximum of 5 people on a team.

faqs.question: Are we required to stay at the venue for the duration of the Datathon?
faqs.answer: No, we would like everyone to be present for the opening and closing ceremonies, but you can choose where you would like to work on your project.

faqs.question: How can I find a team to join?
faqs.answer: There will be time right after opening ceremony to find teammates!

faqs.question: Who can compete in the Datathon?
faqs.answer: Datathon 2020 will be open to all Rice students as well as students from other colleges and universities in and around Houston.

faqs.question: What is the acceptance process?
faqs.answer: All Rice students are guaranteed a spot at the Datathon. Additionally, our goal is to accept almost everyone willing to attend from other nearby colleges.

faqs.question: What kind of prizes will there be?
faqs.answer: The prizes can range from gift cards to cool tech products!

faqs.question: Will there be food?
faqs.answer: Yes, we will provide dinner on Friday followed by breakfast and lunch on Saturday. We'll also have a variety of snacks throughout the event.

faqs.question: Do you reimburse travel expenses?
faqs.answer: Yes, we will reimburse travel from within the Houston area up to a certain amount.

faqs.question: How much experience is required to participate in the Datathon?
faqs.answer: None, we have tracks and challenges that range from introductory to advanced, and some will even have tutorials and tips to help you get started. In addition, you'll find mentors present to help.

faqs.question: What should I bring?
faqs.answer: Definitely bring a laptop and anything else necessary for your project. Besides that, we'd recommend a sleeping bag, a couple friends, and an open mind.
